[Urgent Letter]

Do you remember when the argons attacked Baldera? I have finally found out what they are up to.

When you read this letter, please come to the ancient ruins at the Central Baldera Camp. It's urgent.

Hasmina

You read Hasmina's letter and met your companions at the Central Baldera Camp.

The argons have attacked Baldera again, and Shandra's root has spread to the Spring of Arun.

The root originates in Shandra's Nest. You found out that the argons want to use the power of the spring to resurrect Manahan. They also have a special plan to capture Baldera.

You have decided to take action against Manahan and the argons.

Thank you for coming so quickly.

As you know, the argons have attacked Baldera and are spreading.

I've learned that Dakuryon is aiding Manahan. As we expected, the argons have planted their vile root in the Spring of Arun.

Unfortunately, our soldiers were too weak to stop them.

I could only stand by and watch them plant the root in the spring.

We haven't given up the fight yet, but the argons have captured the spring. The situation is tense.

There is only one reason why the argons would use the power of the spring."To resurrect Manahan?"

Precisely. That power is necessary to bring Manahan into this world.

I was unable to stop them, even though I knew their plan.

My own weakness makes me angry. Just look at that greedy root...

Using the power of the spring isn't so easy.

Don't forget that my clan became addicted when trying to harness it. Without precise knowledge, it is extremely dangerous to try to control its power.

The argons still don't know how to use the power. You have to stop them.
The Argon Priests are trying to use the spring. Take them out.

Ahead of us are Red Argon Incubators.

When argons evolve, they turn red. This evolution requires a lot of energy, however, so they are very rare. I've never seen so many incubators.

The argons must be trying to utilize the power of the spring. "Are they planning to evolve large numbers of argons?"

That seems the only logical answer. The argons are trying to bolster their army.

We need to get an overview of the situation.

The magisters are evolved argons. It's a bad sign for us that they're here.

Let's follow the root. If you own a flying mount, use it to get up there.

The root has spread toward Manaya's Core in Granarkus.

I remember the name... something Manaya..."Do you mean Armen Manaya?"

That's right! Armen Manaya! He is Manahan's son.

The fact that the root leads to Manaya's Core and the situation in general suggest that the argons are following a plan for the capture of Baldera.

We must stop them. Let's head to the base and consider how to proceed.
